intro: Collaea rugosa, commonly known as the rough collaea, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
